title: Macbook Pro *No exit button on any windows & no top or bottom apple menu bars*
message:
usc'd the board, everything came back to life except when running there is no exit button on any windows and there is no apple bar on the top or bottom. i have never seen anything like this or where to start. any advise is welcome  specs- Late 2011 15" 2.4 GHz Core i7 (I7-2760QM) 
Thanks.

title: Macbook Pro *No exit button on any windows & no top or bottom apple menu bars*
message: Tried to boot from a known good OSX?

title: Macbook Pro *No exit button on any windows & no top or bottom apple menu bars*
message: Okay i have tried 2 known good OSX. Update- the board will power on but i get nothing on the screen now, but i see the screen gets a faint glow to it.  i have tested on multiple working screens and one screen put lines down it.  so i know its the board.  all my hdmi to thunderbolt seem broke recently and i have one on the way so will test it to see if im getting external display soon.  also i looked over the board the best i could to see if i could find anything obvious but nothing yet.

title: Macbook Pro *No exit button on any windows & no top or bottom apple menu bars*
message: Could be GPU issue. Apple will fix this for free on the recall program.

title: Macbook Pro *No exit button on any windows & no top or bottom apple menu bars*
message:
Right, i thought about that, but was a little thrown off by the first issue with no exit or top and bottom menu bars.  I already have another 2011 thats going in for gpu replacement so i will just take this one in with that one and hope that its just the gpu.  $50 risk for a $500 board seems okay to me haha. i will update after i take it in. 
Thanks duke!

title: Macbook Pro *No exit button on any windows & no top or bottom apple menu bars*
message: The no exit red dot thing, fucked up bars on the windows, graphical artifacts like lines, squares etc, is what happens when you have no QE/CI (quartz extreme / core image) it will not display the correct resolution and graphics do not render properly because there is no graphics acceleration. Either the kexts are not loading or you have a GPU issue.

title: Macbook Pro *No exit button on any windows & no top or bottom apple menu bars*
message:
[QUOTE="G.Beard, post: 5596"]The no exit red dot thing, fucked up bars on the windows, graphical artifacts like lines, squares etc, is what happens when you have no QE/CI (quartz extreme / core image) it will not display the correct resolution and graphics do not render properly because there is no graphics acceleration. Either the kexts are not loading or you have a GPU issue.[/QUOTE]


Good to know. im going with GPU issue because 2011 are prone for it.  and the guy up the street at the apple cert. is in for the money.
